newsitem.title: USA: Giddings sets record date regarding meeting.
newsitem.headline: Giddings sets record date regarding meeting.

text.p: Giddings & Lewis Inc said Thursday it has set the close of business May 16 as the record date for determining shareholders entitled to demand a special meeting.
The action comes after Giddings received a notice from Harnischfeger Industries Inc, which has made a $19 a share hostile tender offer, requesting that such a record date be set, Giddings said.

Earlier Thursday, Giddings said its board of directors unanimously rejected the offer as inadequate and said that the company has had preliminary discussions with other parties about a possible transaction.

Harnischfeger said the prupose of the meeting was to permit shareholders to vote on measures that will allow the Harnischfeger offer and any other legitimate offers to be considered by all Giddings shareholders.
Giddings shares were up 1/4 at 20-3/4 and Harnischfeger was down 3/4 at 41-1/8 Thursday afternoon.
